results.title: Cambodia: Fields of hope
results.creator_credit: Australian Television Network and Greg Grainger
results.brief_description: As seen on ATN 7s “World Around Us”, this documentary looks at the lives of the Cambodian people one decade after the downfall of Pol Pot. Over one million Cambodians lost their lives as a result of his genocidal policies. A train trip across Cambodia, reveals a country and people freed from the shackles of tyrannical despotism. It is a film of enormous courage which offers a unique insight into the culture and strength of a country torn apart by political and social genocide.

results.title: Cambodia: Cambodia/Kampuchea
results.brief_description: This film exposes the nightmare of the revolution unleashed by Pol Pot’s Khmer Rouge after their victory in 1975. It explains the paranoia and provocation’s that led to the Vietnamese invasion; the famine, exodus and grinding war of resistance that followed; the struggle for peace in Kampuchea that continues to the present day … Cambodia/Kampuchea draws on unique propaganda film and archival material from the Khmer Rouge, Vietnam and other sources.

results.title: Cambodia : the prince & the prophecy
results.brief_description: To understand Cambodia, the film delves to the roots of its culture and its conflicts. It looks back to the time of the great Kings of Angkor, how they ruled and how they survived as their empire crumbled; Cambodia’s fears and response to the thrust of their Vietnamese neighbours; the impact of colonisation by France and the struggle for independence in Indochina after the Second World War. The film explores the years of Prince Norodom Sihanouk’s rule, his juggle for peace, his charisma and contradictions. Following the Prince’s overthrow in 1970, the film traces Cambodia’s destruction during the five years of war before Pol Pot’s Khmer Rouge came to power and launched their revolution.

results.brief_description: Designed for children of pre-school age; the story is set in a village deep in the heart of Never-Never Land among such characters as Peter the Postman, Windy Miller, the miller, and Captain Smart who runs a military academy.

results.title: Calypso Summer
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Lincoln Tyner
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1960-61 a team of cricketers from the West Indies visited Australia. The came as underdogs, and although Australia won the series of Tests, they left the country as one of the most loved sporting teams ever to visit Australia. This video is an informative mixture of archival footage, humourous anecdotes and poignant reflections by surviving players from the Test series, one that has become the benchmark against which all great Test series are judged and compared. Narrated by Michael Habib.

results.title: Calling the shots: the advertising of alcohol
results.creator_credit: Cambridge Documentary Films and Jean Kilbourne
results.brief_description: Based on the research of Jean Kilbourne, media analyst, this film examines images used by advertisers to sell alcohol. This detailed analysis shows how some advertising attracts young people to drink, but also disguises issues like alcohol abuse Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Calling all motorcyclists
results.creator_credit: Film Workshop, Central Office of Information, Maxwell Munden and Dennis Shand
results.brief_description: This film is designed to impress upon all motorcyclists the constant need for care on the roads. It shows that even riders in motorcycle trials, whose performances delight and amaze their fans, do not take chances when they are on the roads, and are in fact more careful than some of the less experienced motorcyclists. Points mentioned include: hand signals, normal care and technique of safe riding; checking petrol, oil, equipment, tyres, wheel ruts, rear brake and steering; braking on a slippery surface; safe riding at night.
